I don't know if this doesn't work because of the app or because the bulb wasn't designed to have it, but I understood it has a blacklight feature which I can't get to work.  In addition, the help file and specifically the troubleshooting portion need to be expanded.

title: Get the other App
text:
If you have the Bluetooth MagicLight, get the MagicLight BT app (by Ryan Schultze). It is very similar to this app but seems to be coded much better. Connection to your bulbs takes about .5-1 second rather than 2-5 seconds that you can expect this app.
In addition to that, the color wheel is integrated with your warm light options and you can save presets WITH brightness values (example: red at 15%) making clean transitions possible (not an option with this app)

I used this app for about 2 years before finding and realizing there was a much better option.

title: Rudimentary app, poor timer support
text:
Needed a timer for my kids to know when it was time to get up.  This was perfect, red for early morning hours, yellow for <30 minutes, then the much anticipated, green! And yes, this bulb + app support this 100%

But there’s a catch.  Close the app & turn off the power to bulb (remember, it’s in a kids room, either on a switch OR plugged in), and ALL timer information is lost and you’re expected to start over.  It fails to save state.  And forget multi device (e.g. my wife) support. 

All in all, it’s an great gimmick bulb.  But the app needs a lot of polish.  First time user experience is rough, and it’s primary use case expects you to own many of these products and to set into groups.  Somehow, I expect that 95% or more of customers own only 1, so I’m not sure why such heavy focus on groups.

Anyways, fix the timer support, and maybe it gets a three.  Polish the app, and maybe three.five.  But as long as the companion bulb LOSES all settings every time it loses physical power, this device will never be ready for “mission critical” applications (think: security, children), which I feel is where a 4.0 rating starts.
